data.title: Worth a Trip
data.text: Decided to pop in while on a day trip to see the Truman Library. Always listed as a favorite locally. It didn't disappoint. Had the daily lunch special of tempura shrimp po boy with fries. Excellent choice. Fries were piping hot and the pool boy added a nice Napa slaw.

data.title: Awesome and delicious 😋
data.text:
We visited Ophelia's while my husband was on a business trip to Independence. This restaurant was recommended by friends who had eaten there several years ago. They said the food and atmosphere was wonderful and we decided to try it out before us for ourselves. 

We were NOT disappointed. We made a reservation and were seated immediately upon arrival. Our waiter was extremely attentive(wish I could remember his name)and such a nice guy.   He gave us ample time to choose our meals and gave us suggestions when we inquired about the dishes they were serving. 

I ordered the special, prime tips. They were delicious and so tender. They came with garlic mashed potatoes, grilled Brussels sprouts and carmelized onions. So very delicious and plenty of food. 

I would recommend Ophelia's to anyone in the Independence area. They do get very crowded on the weekend so I would suggest you make reservations before you go. 

This was an awesome and enjoyable evening for both of us. We will definitely go back to Ophelia's if we are ever back in the area. Thanks for a great evening.  Oh yea, for dessert I ordered crem brûlée. It was wonderful.  I loved it❤️❤️

data.title: Great monthly get together
data.text:
Monthly get together fives of us ladiys for a birthday.  Food was excellent, server even better, we were discussing the benefits of ginger, she said we serve a cocktail with
shredded ginger, she brought us some to add to our water. The food was excellent.
For the birthday girl she brought out home made Gelalo in six favors, one better then
the other, my favorite was the lemon.  👍👍🎂

data.title: WOW!!! burgers
data.text: The very best burgers in the world come off my smoker. I didn't think there were any burgers even close. Mine are still best, but these compare. I was impressed and very happy to have eaten one. I have no idea about the hotel stuff.

data.title: One of my favorite lunch places
data.text:
This is a gem in historic downtown Independence.  Food is excellent - eclectic menu with something for everyone.  My favorite is the Greek Orzo with Shrimp.  It is outstanding.  My friend got the chicken salad sandwich and loved it.  Service is consistently good. 

It is also an Inn.  While I have never stayed here, the location is outstanding for tourism and if they run their Inn the way they run their restaurant you won't be appointed.

data.title: Very nice!
data.text: Stayed Saturday night with the wife and really enjoyed it! The room was nice and clean, and the restaurant and bar downstairs was very good.  You must try the Sunday brunch, it rivals anything we have had anywhere!

data.title: Wonderful Experience!
data.text: Our room was lovely , very comfortable bed, and a delicious buffet brunch on Sunday morning . There were so  many choices included in  the brunch and even roast beef sliced to order. Staying on the square was fun and we had a lovely walk around the square waiting our family for our brunch The staff were so nice and attended to any questions we had during our stay.

data.title: Great attention to detail
data.text: The food was fresh and fantastic! My friend had the chili salmon salad. The greens were crisp while the salmon was grilled to perfection. The chili was not too overpowering.  Good blend of flavor.  Also a half order for lunch was sufficient. I chose the grilled Cuban. The pork belly was a little tough and fatty but overall not a bad sandwich.  Again, the flavors blended well. I had the side of seasonal vegetables which was marinated asparagus and grape tomatoes. Delicious! Our server could have been better informed. She was unsure what the seasonal vegetable was so I gambled.  Another customer asked what was her fav on the menu and she said they all were.

data.title: A Great Place to Stay
data.text: We love staying at Ophelia's.  This is a boutique style hotel.  The rooms are very cool and the location is convenient to downtown Independence as it is right on the square.  The rooms are large, clean and comfortable.  They offer a cooked breakfast each morning from a set menu with 5 or 6 choices.  If you are staying in Independence I would definitely recommend staying at Ophelia's.

data.title: Large Party 50th Birthday Celebration
data.text: My husband and I have been to Ophelia's a hand full of times.  One anniversary we even stayed upstairs at the Inn (thats another review) after a lovely celebratory dinner! This time my husband and 13 of our closest friends pulled a surprise shenanigans on me 2 1/2 weeks before my 50th.  Our group shared cocktails as we waited for our meal.  Evidently the long island was made to perfection as those kept coming!  Hats off to the bartender, my sidekick is really picky about his long islands! We ordered several different items off the menu.  Everything was superb!  Salads, Chicken, Seafood - you seriously can't go wrong. But to finish the night off...the gelato sampler was fabulous.  The staff was totally on top of it!  Kudos to the service and personality to boot.  Don't forget to take a walk around the square and get a pic with President Truman

data.title: Excellent chocolate dessert!
data.text: The restaurant was bustling, but still easy to have a conversation. Nice wine list, large selection. Entrees varied and delicious. Service was very good, and staff was knowledgeable about the menu. Appropriate for a special night out.

data.title: Great food & Service
data.text:
Met old friends for an annual Christmas get-together.
The food & service were excellent. Shortly after we arrived we realized we were the only patrons in the restaurant and it remained that way for the rest of the evening (a Monday). It certainly couldn't have been because of the food. Three of us had the Atlantic Salmon stuffed with crab on a bed of vegetables. Excellent, and more than any of us could consume. It had been at least 5 years since we last dined here, mostly because we live about 3 hours away now. We will definitely try very hard to decrease that interval.

data.title: Not Good Birthday Dinner!
data.text: Took my family (9 people) for my husbands birthday, our table was  set for 7, this was the beginning.  Husbands food, pork medallions, were very dry & risotta was mushy.  Two tables around us were left dirty and not because the place was full, hardly anyone there.  Took 15 minutes for 6 desserts and 30 for the benets.  Really disappointed in the whole experience, good things were the music and our waitress, obviously she was embarrassed for the situation.

data.title: Special
data.text: This is a great private and special option for an over night stay. The rooms are very unique with amazing and beautiful furniture in each. They have views of the independence square. The brunch is amazing and very top notch! Great staff! Hotel is only about 6 rooms. No staff on duty at night but have a key to get in and out at all times. Very intimate and special place!

data.title: We were impressed
data.text: My wife and I stayed there for a get-a-way weekend and we were impressed.  We stayed int he large corner room.  It was huge with a round setting area. Our dinner was amazing and the Sunday brunch is one of the best you will get anywhere in the US.  There is not a lot do to on the square but there are plenty of great places to eat.

data.title: Great food, great atmosphere and great service
data.text:
A previous reviewer gave a very unfair review by marking Ophelia's down for actually trying to close at the posted closing time.  Are you kidding?  What nerve.  If a restaurant closes at 10:00 pm, then do not show up at 9:30 pm for dinner.  If you are already there and wait until 10:02 pm to finally order dessert...then you need to look in the mirror and ask yourself why you have such a high opinion of yourself.  I guess no one else is supposed to have a family to get home to.  My daughter & nieces worked in this field while going to college and ran into these types of people all the time.  Only the place they worked for made them stay to wait on these people that arrive right at closing time.  Guess what kind of tips they received?  Usually nothing.  Sometimes a dollar or two.  Try to think of others sometimes instead of just yourself.

I am going to dinner at Ophelia's on Valentines Day with the hubby and I am looking forward to having a wonderful meal for the second time (during operating hours).  Very much looking forward to it!  Yum!

data.title: Nice Place to Stay in Independence MO
data.text: I stayed at Ophelia's Restaurant and Inn while traveling back from Lincoln, NE.  Because I love history, I wanted to see the Harry Truman Historical Sites.  The Inn is located above the restaurant. My room at the Inn was very nice.  It was clean and comfortable. Breakfast was included and you ate in their restaurant.  You ordered it the night before along with the time you planned on being down for breakfast.

data.title: Good Food--Service needs improvement
data.text: Our party of five dined at the restaurant . We had a reservation and were seated immediately. A server brought us water but it took some time for our waitress to come to our table. We ordered wine and it took quite awhile to get our drinks. Two of us did the tasting menu. Our salad/appetizer came out in an appropriate amount of time and both were good- salad and shrimp tempura; entrees came out quickly. Two people had the brick chicken which was moist and flavorful. Other dishes our party had were the short ribs, spa salmon, which were good. Another person had another fried fish entree that was not cooked through.  Two of us had the gelato as part of tasting menu- good but very small portion . Others had chocolate variety plate but felt soufflé was undercooked. One person ordered a 2nd glass of wine that never arrived. Waitress did not stay on top of water/drink refills.  The menu had a good variety but for the prices we expected better service especially since they weren't that busy.

data.title: Oh MY!
data.text: Went to Ophelia's for a delayed anniversary dinner and all I can say is "Oh MY!"  It was excellent. Everything about the experience was great.  Ribeye Steak for my husband with garlic mash potatoes and mine was pork tenderloins with a boursin(?) cheese that was to die for.  Ate until we were stuffed.  Food was cooked perfect.  Waiter was great.  Would recommend it become a favorite place to eat.

data.title: Food and service great!
data.text:
We chose to have our wedding reception at Ophelia's and then have our wedding party stay at the Inn upstairs. I have to say everything was perfect, the banquet managers did a fantastic job working with us on everything. The food was amazing, everyone could not praise the food enough. We had the beef tenderloin, the chicken with goat cheese and pesto, and the grilled salmon and many people including my husband had all three options. 
After the reception, which the wonderful staff at Ophelias offered to tear down for us, we went upstairs to their Inn. The master suite was beautiful, I just wish we had stayed there another night to be able to fully relax and enjoy the beauty of the Inn. 
Whether you are looking for delicious food or a beautiful, comfortable room to stay in, you will not go wrong with choosing Ophelias.
